title: Dermatitis herpetiformis
summary: Dermatitis herpetiformis (DH) is a chronic autoimmune blistering skin condition,[3] characterised by intensely itchy blisters filled with a watery fluid.[4] DH is a cutaneous manifestation of coeliac disease,[5] although the exact causal mechanism is not known. DH is neither related to nor caused by herpes virus; the name means that it is a skin inflammation having an appearance (Latin: -formis) similar to herpes.
